intro: Racosperma dacrydioides, commonly known as the narrow-leafed acacia, is a shrub or small tree native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant features bipinnate leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets. It produces yellow to orange flowers arranged in spikes, which are followed by narrow, leathery pods. Racosperma dacrydioides is adapted to dry environments and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands.
